ygData.subject: New patch coming up   ;)
ygData.msgSnippet: Spells -Ice Comet has been deemed too strong. The damage has been reduced by 93% and you now need runes that are only found on Cazic-Thule and Innoruuk. Who
ygData.messageBody:
Spells

-Ice Comet has been deemed too strong. The damage has been reduced by 93% and you now
need runes that are only found on Cazic-Thule and Innoruuk. Who cares if the Hate plane isn't right
yet? Screw you.

-All of the Magicians Summon spells now require Diamonds.

-Druids can no longer cast Spirit of Wolf. This was deemed bad for the economy. Druids cannot
make money off of anything! Therefore, we have replaced it with Spirit of Slug. It reduces one
player's speed by 98%. It has been deemed unfair on the PvP+ server (no plural...we're just
screwing with you about Race War), so it will have neither spell.

-Clerics can no longer Heal. This was bad for Geoff' Zatkin's ego. Instead, each Heal spell of the
Cleric has been replaced with a Summon Gnoll Pup spell.

-Paladins Lay on Hands wasn't good enough for the economy. It has been replaced with Sit on
Hands.

-Rangers don't get spells anymore. It was bad for our brain cells.

-Warriors now have Complete Healing for no mana at level 1, because we're tired of listening to
whiny people. it's bad for our patience.

-All Bard spells require mana now. Why? Because we like screwing with you!

-Enchanters can now enchant items...but only Rusty Daggers, Iron Rations, and Ice Goblin
Necklaces.

-Necromancers have a new summon spell to replace each one from level 4 up, "Summon McQuaid

-Shamans can now cast Enlarge. This will be popular with people on this development team.

-All Trolls can now cast Burst of Flame when they are facing away from their foe.

Skills

-Rangers tracking was bad for the economy. Therefore, they now have a new command: "Find
Your Ass With Two Hands", because this is what we wish we could do.

-Rogues Make Poison was deemed bad for the economy already. We have replaced it with
Diagonal Lower Right Stab.

-Warriors now have Healing Kick. It heals them when they kick. Why? Because a lot of people
bugged us about things. We didn't even really read them. But remember, we're keeping it
balanced!

-Shadow Knights now have no skills. This was to improve the class. Also, Shadow Knights can
only equip Rusty weapons. Why? Because at level 10+ the Rusty weapon economy is bad.

Trades

-The Jewelers Kit now costs 29000pp. People were becoming filthy rich bastards off of Jewelcraft.

-Blacksmithing has been removed from the game, because it was profitable.

-Pottery now makes potties only. You see, Tom Buck thought that was hilarious [sic].

-Brewery can only make non-alcoholic beverages, to dispel rumors that we are drunk when we
come up with this stuff.

-The new skill, "Meth Lab", has been implement because we can relate to it.

-Tailoring was REALLY upsetting the economy. You can now tailor ONLY with the Skimpiest of
Vox and the Undies of Ungar, two items we haven't put in yet and probably never will. Mwa ha ha.

-Baking has been totally revamped. For instance, Sugar now costs 78pp, plus a 99pp down
payment at 76% interest over four months. The economy needed it, people.

-Every other trade skill has been removed, because we want to go home.

MOBs
-All MOBs that are level 1 and up are now aggro. This help the economy.

-The Ghoulbane is now on a level 2 Dark Elf Shadow Knight in the Temple of Cazic-Thule. We don't
really give a flying defecation if it makes sense, it's OUR game, so, screw off!

-I don't want to spoil anything, of course, but you can find the Sword of Slashing Stuff, a 36/4
Magical Item that randomly casts Brad Breath, a 56000 point damage spell, on Emporer Tush in
Grobb (Hey, we don't care if we spell it right or not. As our company motto says, "Screw you!").
Whoops. My mistake. I seem to forget there is a Backspace key. Oh well.

Thanks for playing! All the servers will be coming down for two months by the time you read this.
Made ya patch!
"

Gratefully taken from the Cackling Klacknak which managed to cheer me up after the most
ridiculous, drawn out, and generally unecessary death that made me log tonight.
